definition: lit. candle in the wind (idiom)/fig. (of sb's life) feeble/hanging on a thread
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.chinese: 猶如那搖曳的風中之燭。

sentences.english: Keep off fame and wealth; crave not external attractions. Always see life as a candle flickering in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 勿涉足名利，勿貪戀外境，時刻視生命如風中之燭。

sentences.english: Like a candle in the wind.
Our lives are like a candle in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 我們的生命如同風中之燭。

sentences.english: The sad sex symbol is still a candle in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 這個憂傷的性感女神依然是風中之燭。
